author: KATE FELDMAN
title: Grammys 2017 winners and losers
text:
Grammys 2017 winners and losers Grammys 2017 winners and losers The big winners of the 2017 Grammy Awards. (Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Updated:  43 PM 
Beyoncé headlines the 2017 Grammy Awards with nine nominations, including Album of the Year and Song of The Year, but the night promises upsets and snubs. 
Drake, Kanye West and Rihanna follow the “Formation” singer with eight nominations, while Chance the Rapper, Adele, Justin Bieber and Twenty One Pilots are all vying for their own victory speech. 
Check back throughout the night as we update the winners. Record of the Year 
“7 Years” by Lukas Graham 
“Work” by Rihanna feat. Drake 
“Stressed Out” by Twenty One Pilots Album of the Year 
"A Sailor's Guide to Earth" by Sturgill Simpson Song of the Year 
"Hello" by Adele Adkins & Greg Kurstin, songwriters 
"I Took a Pill in Ibiza" by Mike Posner 
"Love Yourself" by Justin Bieber, Benjamin Levin & Ed Sheeran, songwriters 
"7 Years" by Lukas Forchhammer, Stefan Forrest, Morten Pilegaard & Morten Ristorp, songwriters 
"Formation" by Khalif Brown, Asheton Hogan, Beyoncé Knowles & Michael L. Williams II, songwriters Best New Artist 
"Love Yourself" by Justin Bieber 
"Dangerous Woman" by Ariana Grande 
"Piece by Piece (Idol Version)" by Kelly Clarkson Best Pop Duo/Group Performance 
"Closer" by The Chainsmokers feat. Halsey 
"7 Years" by Lukas Graham 
"Work" by Rihanna feat. Drake 
"Cheap Thrills" by Sia feat. Sean Paul 
"Stressed Out" by Twenty One Pilots Best Traditional Pop Vocal Album 
"Fallen Angels" by Bob Dylan 
"Stages Live" by Josh Groban 
"Summertime: Willie Nelson Sings Gershwin" by Willie NelsonCinema by Andrea Bocelli 
"Encore: Movie Partners Sing Broadway" by Barbra Streisand 
"Cinema" by Andrea Bocelli 
"This is Acting" by Sia 
"Dangerous Woman" by Ariana Grande 
"25" by Adele 
“Burn The Witch” by Radiohead 
“Hardwired” by James Hetfield & Lars Ulrich 
“Heathens” by Tyler Joseph 
“My Name Is Human” by Rich Meyer, Ryan Meyer & Johnny Stevens Best Rock Album 
“Tell Me I’m Pretty” by Cage The Elephant” 
“Magma” by Gojira 
“Death Of A Bachelor” by Panic! At The Disco 
“Weezer” by Weezer 
“22, A Million” by Bon Iver 
“Blackstar” by David Bowie 
“The Hope Six Demolition Project” by PJ Harvey 
“Post Pop Depression” by Iggy Pop 
“A Moon Shaped Pool” by Radiohead Best Rap/Sung Performance 
"Famous" by Kanye West feat. Rihanna 
"Ultralight Beam" by Kanye West feat. Chance the Rapper 
"Freedom" by Beyoncé feat. Kendrick Lamar 
"Hotline Bling" by Drake 
"Broccoli" by D.R.A.M. featuring Lil Yachty Best Rap Album 
"The Life of Pablo" by Kanye West 
"Views" by Drake 
"Major Key" by DJ Khaled 
"Blank Face LP" by ScHoolboy Q 
"Coloring Book" by Chance the Rapper Best Country Solo Performance 
“Love Can Go To Hell” by Brandy Clark 
“Vice” by Miranda Lambert 
“My Church” by Maren Morris 
“Church Bells” by Carrie Underwood 
“Blue Ain’t Your Color” by Keith Urban Best Country Duo/Group Performance 
“Different For Girls” by Dierks Bentley feat. Elle King 
“21 Summer” by Brothers Osborne 
“Setting The World On Fire” by Kenny Chesney and Pink 
“Jolene” by Pentatonix feat. Dolly Parton - WINNER 
“Think Of You” by Chris Young with Cassadee Pope Best Country Album 
“Big Day In A Small Town” by Brandy Clark 
“Full Circle” by Loretta Lynn 
“Hero” by Maren Morris 
“A Sailor’s Guide To Earth” by Sturgill Simpson - WINNER 
“Ripcord” by Keith Urban
